newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's March copper output rises 3.4 percent.
newsitem.headline: Peru's March copper output rises 3.4 percent.

text.p: Peru's copper output rose 3.4 percent to 43,00 tonnes in March compared with the same month last year, according to preliminary figures released Thursday by the Energy and Mines Ministry.
Copper output rose 7.7 percent to 122,000 tonnes in the first quarter, compared with the same period last year, the ministry added in its monthly report.
In 1996, Peru's copper output rose by 18.1 percent to 483,880 tonnes from 409,693 tonnes in 1995.
Peru is the world's sixth largest copper producer. The country's largest producer, Southern Peru Copper Corp, accounts for around 60 percent of the country's output.
